caption: An extraordinary artist, creator and sculptress, Chana Orloff blew my socks off!  She hung with Zadkine and Modigliani and yet she isn’t as famous as them.  Frankly she touches my soul in a way they cannot.  She uses so many mediums and it is clear she is a mother and woman.  She captures both so beautifully!  What a treasure her atelier is!  The street is incredible and historic as well!  I do wish there were English translations available but google helped!

The atelier of Chana Orloff is open by appointment only and it's worth the appointment! The street itself is worth a visit. The architecture and quiet charm of this "village" in the heart of Paris is a must visit even if only half interested in architecture. As a photographer I loved it, and the atelier of Mme Orloff is spectacular. Her works are full of humanity, sensuality, compassion and matriachal bonding. Take an hour out and go there you won't regret it.
Week-end
Amazing

Villa Seurat is a cul-de-sac that is worth a walk. As for the Chana Orloff workshop-museum, visited with one of her grandsons as a guide, it is a very beautiful and moving experience. We feel the presence of this strong woman with an incredible destiny and whose gentle, sometimes funny and always very powerful works welcome you warmly. You would almost expect to hear Ms. Orloff coming down the stairs from the apartment above to tell you about this client wanting a sculpture of her dachshund and sending her driver to harass the great artist almost every day. Take the time to book a conference visit, it will be a unique experience in the world of Parisian art. You will definitely want to come back.

I love the fabulous studio of Chana Orloff, an exceptional artist whose work continues to captivate and inspire me. Located in a setting that exudes history and creativity, this workshop-museum is a true hidden treasure. The visit, narrated by her grandson, offers an intimate and enriching perspective on the life and work of Chana Orloff. Very informed and passionate, he shares not only family anecdotes but also the importance of his grandmother's art in the contemporary world. This unique experience is a fascinating immersion into the legacy of an artist who marked her time. Don't miss the opportunity to delve into the world of Chana Orloff, where each sculpture and each space tells a story of artistic passion and family devotion. The only criticism I can make is that the place is small, so beyond 20 people we step on each other and we lose intimacy with the works

In this sublime Villa Seurat (Paris 14), stop at the Atelier-Museum Chana Orloff to discover the captivating work of this artist of Ukrainian origin (1888-1968). The visit is either guided or free but by reservation (9€) In addition, she is a very smiling young girl who will welcome you and answer all your questions.

Private tour with a group of 13 people, and the fascinating guide Maxime PAZ close to the Orloff family; at the end of the visit the presence of a grandson of the artist added an even more intimate note. Exciting visit, talented artist, great portraitist, courageous in life which was not easy at the time when she lived with war and anti-Semitism.

This museum is the workshop of the world-famous sculptor Chana Orloff in the 20th century. The people who are in charge of the presentation of this place and the works are the grandchildren of the artist and are exceptional, therefore a must to discover a place, an artist and magnificent works.
Very nice workshop. Very beautiful sculptures. Very pleasant guided tour.
Very nice museum workshop. Visit commented by his grandchildren.

Many works are presented in this in-house workshop! We loved the visit and discovering the story of Chana Orloff. The museum is intimate, lively and the welcome is individualized. It's rare. Free visit to book!
Very pleasant place. Beautiful exhibition. Very interesting conference by the descendants of the artist. Shows that an iron will allows you to overcome life's obstacles.

Villa Seurat brings together several workshops or private mansions built from 1924 to 1926 for different artists. It opens into a dead end lined with houses built, eight of them, by André Lurçat. Salvador Dali lived at 101 bis, rue de la Tombe-Issoire at the corner of the Villa Seurat. At No. 3 and 3bis, there were the workshops of the painters Marcel Gromaire and Édouard Goerg, at No. 4, the house of Jean Lurçat, at No. 7bis, at No. 9 and 11, the workshops of Madame Bertrand and the Swiss sculptor Arnold Huggler. At number 18, lived among others Henry Miller, Anais Nin and Soutine. At No. 7 bis is the house-studio of the sculptor Chana Orloff (1888-1968), built by the architect Auguste Perret, one of the fathers of French architectural Modernism, in 1926.

A great moment in this workshop where you are received by Ariane, the small town of Chana Orloff who tells you about the work, the life of her grandmother with passion and simplicity. Sculptures, drawings, engravings, everything is within reach and we leave happy from this visit. You have to take advantage of all these houses at Villa Seurat, each more interesting than the last.

Tremendous! A very interesting visit... we were lucky that the speaker was the artist's granddaughter. His presentation of the life and work of his grandmother was fascinating and full of emotions. Chana Orloff is a major sculptor of the 20th century.

Hello, I admit that I was disappointed with my visit last night to the flashlight in the workshop of this great sculptor. The place is magnificent but in the faint glow of the playful lamp but not very suitable because given the flowering of the sculptures I did not feel the enhancement of the works which were rather stored without any real little notice or card mentioning the name, date etc... computer boxes under the works, it’s a shame because they’re neglected. Sorry, I imagine that the heirs are doing their best but no small document or frieze mentioning the pivotal dates of this great Artist. I am a neophyte but sensitive to Beauty and despite the good reception of the people who received us even late. Everything was very cold despite Chana Orloff's lively videos on screen.

I love this resolutely modern artist with a unique style. His house is full of treasures. Incredible talent, remarkable precision in expressions. Why she is not better known is a mystery to me. I have the impression of being privileged because I know her.. thank you Mrs. Orloff

Being able to discover the studio of this great artist during heritage days was a great experience! What a character and what an almost crossing of the century! Truly impressive! The passage is so incredibly rich, those who walked it created the art of the past century. I highly recommend this nostalgic stroll.

It's a place that I loved.  The place is interesting to know for its architecture and its location on a private street.  I really like Chana Orloff's sculptures and her career as an artist. I will go back 😀
Very interesting visit to this workshop where Chana Orloff lived, the works are moving, magnificent.
A magical workshop. The artist's life and work were told to us by his granddaughter. I recommend that you discover this sculptor, remarkable for her style and her career!

An inexpressible happiness, priceless beauties and curiously in this artist's work, materials, styles of the animal artist with such expressive portraits and wonderfully diversified representations.  Imperative: you must discover again and again without moderation.  All about a tormented life

An absolutely fascinating exhibition visit, Ariane, Chana Orloff's granddaughter, tells you about this extraordinary journey of this woman sculptor and I fell in love at first sight with these round sculptures and beautiful portraits! A must do!!!
Very beautiful Villa Seurat workshop which will be open to the public from January 18, 2019! Her grandson was present to give explanations about his grandmother's life

Very moving visit to the studio of one of the greatest artists of the 20th century. The visit is very well organized by the artist's grandchildren. Journey through the 20th century where we meet Soutine, Bernstein, Anaïs Nin and many others
It was magnificent! Very interesting!
Visited by torchlight during museum night. The museum is small, but well stocked with Orloff sculptures.
The visit is led by the artist's grandson and is fascinating.
Lots of emotion, breathtaking, it was a real artistic shock for me Thanks to Ariane, granddaughter of the artist, for this visit!
A unique and unusual place. It was Chana Orloff's granddaughter who introduced us to her workshop.
Magnificent and astonishing discovery of this workshop. Exceptional and admirable sculptor of courage and determination, like many Ukrainians.

Well yes, certainly an extra ordinary place, but too many boo-boos, (in any case when I was there during the music festival), racking their brains to be seen and heard, without any respect for the artists that were happening...
A discovery of the place and the artist, very interesting and enriching.
Very pleasant visit to discover Chana Orloff
Super nice visit led by the artist's grandson The building itself is worth the detour!
A place that allows you to discover the work and soul of a great artist. Not to be missed
A beautiful place, amazing sculptures in the spirit of the time with stories behind the sculptures Highly recommended!
